input:
***Slots are extremely intriguing and interesting creatures!***

---

![IMG_20180502_135629.jpg](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmZy3YaJE1EgQeqru7vu82mpvgxVTJg7Q2CcMidyG3oZMD/IMG_20180502_135629.jpg)

---

I found this fella hanging from the branch of a tree, and I didn't hesitate to take as many pictures as I could of this unique and amazing specimen of nature. I was probably seeing a sloth in person for the first time, but what fascinated me most was being able to see its *slow motion* live in action. *Yes, they are infamously slow in their actions!*  The most memorable sloth scene I can remember seeing onscreen is from the animated movie Zootopia, and if you don't know what I'm talking about you can go watch the hilarious clip on [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bY73vFGhSVk&feature=youtu.be&t=16). The sloth shown in the pictures below was quite hungry, and as it slowly made its way from one food piece to another I stood there watching intently.

---

![IMG_20180502_135529.jpg](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmYmSPBhFHQ8RTArHSKFWKmvgwY7XzLTPA1wD5MpV6vkzR/IMG_20180502_135529.jpg)

![IMG_20180502_135535.jpg](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmfWYHGJjMZzJkFseKCtLmhyAYTyUVHb7Q9soLWR871q38/IMG_20180502_135535.jpg)

![IMG_20180502_135542.jpg](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmTWk6eK7NQXCP5beevzx3vMjXikHfrYnunc4xmwiwjWcj/IMG_20180502_135542.jpg)

![IMG_20180502_135603.jpg](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmePRVi4dSjYEG91Dv3bsG6Gd9fpDG3eJQ3AsKACu2Zk3T/IMG_20180502_135603.jpg)

![IMG_20180502_135605.jpg](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmWibUzLKNJCro2PBFKC28jxXJKjKLRsxt5ccMxJa8xtCH/IMG_20180502_135605.jpg)

![IMG_20180502_135614.jpg](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmUAHhxwYDgnbeL4oyiVSybYKQU5zm7aUveSrtRGNpS48n/IMG_20180502_135614.jpg)

![IMG_20180502_135617.jpg](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmaEjMCeLHZBF7eXTFZA89zLMHuMFHrMXCdWxdJb5QHFcv/IMG_20180502_135617.jpg)

![IMG_20180502_135621.jpg](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmce7m6ywZ4w9wBpXWDqL5JGcAd6N3fQMShUFVAyHPt5Wg/IMG_20180502_135621.jpg)

![IMG_20180502_135627.jpg](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmXvR5W3swWJXjTsQ76nvVzSEPLFYWa3Lhq4hJDrmqbvJk/IMG_20180502_135627.jpg)

---

### Apparently sloths have a very slow metabolic rate, and the food they eat doesn't provide them the kind of energy needed to move about in a faster manner. The way that these animals have evolved is certainly peculiar and odd, yet it is also this feature that makes them uniquely fascinating!
*Have you ever seen a sloth?*

# Thank you for reading!

result:
Slots are extremely intriguing and interesting creatures!

I found this fella hanging from the branch of a tree, and I didn't hesitate to take as many pictures as I could of this unique and amazing specimen of nature. I was probably seeing a sloth in person for the first time, but what fascinated me most was being able to see its slow motion live in action. Yes, they are infamously slow in their actions! The most memorable sloth scene I can remember seeing onscreen is from the animated movie Zootopia, and if you don't know what I'm talking about you can go watch the hilarious clip on YouTube. The sloth shown in the pictures below was quite hungry, and as it slowly made its way from one food piece to another I stood there watching intently.

Apparently sloths have a very slow metabolic rate, and the food they eat doesn't provide them the kind of energy needed to move about in a faster manner. The way that these animals have evolved is certainly peculiar and odd, yet it is also this feature that makes them uniquely fascinating!

Have you ever seen a sloth?

Thank you for reading!
